title: Banana
data:
**[English]()**

 • [한국어](/wiki/Banana/ko "Banana/ko")

 • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Banana/zh-CN "Banana/zh-CN")

| % [![Banana.png](/images/6/69/Banana.png)](/wiki/File:Banana.png) |                                        |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                              | banana                                 |
| Base price                                                        | 9 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")        |
| Nutrition                                                         | [80](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")      |
| Turns to eat                                                      | 1                                      |
| Weight                                                            | [2](/wiki/Weight "Weight")             |
| Conduct                                                           | [vegan](/wiki/Conduct#Vegan "Conduct") |

A **banana** is a type of [veggy](/wiki/Veggy "Veggy") [comestible](/wiki/Comestible "Comestible") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [4.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.4 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [4.5 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Tourists may start with oranges among their random food items.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

[Kicking](/wiki/Kick "Kick") a tree has a one-time 14⁄15 chance of dropping (8−[rnl](/wiki/Rnl "Rnl")(7)) bananas.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) Cutting down a tree has a 1⁄5 chance of producing a piece of fruit that can be a banana.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) If a tree is [tunneled](/wiki/Tunnel "Tunnel") through, there is a 1⁄3 chance of fruit being left behind, which can be a banana.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

[Applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a [charged](/wiki/Charged "Charged") [horn of plenty](/wiki/Horn_of_plenty "Horn of plenty") has a 0.9% chance of generating a banana or two.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

## Description

[Eating](/wiki/Eating "Eating") a banana confers 80 nutrition. Bananas are vegan, and can be used to tame [domestic](/wiki/Domestic "Domestic") [herbivorous](/wiki/Herbivorous "Herbivorous") [monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster").

[Apes](/wiki/Ape "Ape") and [monkeys](/wiki/Monkey "Monkey") can be [tamed](/wiki/Tame "Tame") with thrown bananas, and along with [sasquatches](/wiki/Sasquatch "Sasquatch") they regard them as [treats](/wiki/Treat "Treat").[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

## History

The banana first appears in Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, which is based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and is included in the initial item list for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), all [apelike creatures](/wiki/Apelike_creature "Apelike creature") can be tamed with thrown bananas.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), the Pacman [random vault](/wiki/Random_vault_\(UnNetHack\) "Random vault (UnNetHack)") has a guaranteed banana at a random position.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"), [Pirates](/wiki/Pirate "Pirate") start the game with 3-6 bananas; [incantifier](/wiki/Incantifier "Incantifier") Pirates have their bananas replaced with scrolls of [food detection](/wiki/Scroll_of_food_detection "Scroll of food detection"). [Clockwork automata](/wiki/Clockwork_Automaton_\(starting_race\) "Clockwork Automaton (starting race)") characters in roles that would start with bananas are instead given potions of [oil](/wiki/Potion_of_oil "Potion of oil").

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), Pirates start the game with 3-6 bananas as in dNetHack, and incantifier Pirates receive scrolls of food detection instead.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), Pirates start the game with 3-6 bananas as in dNetHack.

## Encyclopedia entry

He took another step and she cocked her right wrist in  
viciously. She heard the spring click. Weight slapped into  
her hand.  
"Here!" she shrieked hysterically, and brought her arm up in  
a hard sweep, meaning to gut him, leaving him to blunder  
around the room with his intestines hanging out in steaming  
loops. Instead he roared laughter, hands on his hips,  
flaming face cocked back, squeezing and contorting with great  
good humor.  
"Oh, my dear!" he cried, and went off into another gale of  
laughter.  
She looked stupidly down at her hand. It held a firm yellow  
banana with a blue and white Chiquita sticker on it. She  
dropped it, horrified, to the carpet, where it became a  
sickly yellow grin, miming Flagg's own.  
"You'll tell," he whispered. "Oh yes indeed you will."  
And Dayna knew he was right.

\[ The Stand, by Stephen King ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 144](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L144)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/dokick.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1115](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/dokick.c#L1115)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/dig.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 398](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/dig.c#L398)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/dig.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1321](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/dig.c#L1321)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/mkobj.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2219](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mkobj.c#L2219): *any comestible that can be randomly generated is eligible*
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [src/mondata.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 232](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mondata.h#L232)
7. [↑](#cite_ref-7) [src/dog.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 826](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/dog.c#L826)

html:
Banana

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 한국어

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
%
Name banana
Base price 9 zm
Nutrition 80
Turns to eat 1
Weight 2
Conduct vegan

A banana is a type of veggy comestible that appears in NetHack.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 History
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SLASH'EM
    • 4.2 UnNetHack
    • 4.3 dNetHack
    • 4.4 SlashTHEM
    • 4.5 Hack'EM
  • 5 Encyclopedia entry
  • 6 References

Generation

Tourists may start with oranges among their random food items.[1]

Kicking a tree has a one-time 14⁄15 chance of dropping (8−rnl(7)) bananas.[2] Cutting down a tree has a 1⁄5 chance of producing a piece of fruit that can be a banana.[3] If a tree is tunneled through, there is a 1⁄3 chance of fruit being left behind, which can be a banana.[4]

Applying a charged horn of plenty has a 0.9% chance of generating a banana or two.[5]

Description

Eating a banana confers 80 nutrition. Bananas are vegan, and can be used to tame domestic herbivorous monsters.

Apes and monkeys can be tamed with thrown bananas, and along with sasquatches they regard them as treats.[6][7]

History

The banana first appears in Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, which is based on Jay Fenlason's Hack, and is included in the initial item list for Hack 1.0.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, all apelike creatures can be tamed with thrown bananas.

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, the Pacman random vault has a guaranteed banana at a random position.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack, Pirates start the game with 3-6 bananas; incantifier Pirates have their bananas replaced with scrolls of food detection. Clockwork automata characters in roles that would start with bananas are instead given potions of oil.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, Pirates start the game with 3-6 bananas as in dNetHack, and incantifier Pirates receive scrolls of food detection instead.

Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, Pirates start the game with 3-6 bananas as in dNetHack.

Encyclopedia entry

He took another step and she cocked her right wrist in
viciously. She heard the spring click. Weight slapped into
her hand.
"Here!" she shrieked hysterically, and brought her arm up in
a hard sweep, meaning to gut him, leaving him to blunder
around the room with his intestines hanging out in steaming
loops. Instead he roared laughter, hands on his hips,
flaming face cocked back, squeezing and contorting with great
good humor.
"Oh, my dear!" he cried, and went off into another gale of
laughter.
She looked stupidly down at her hand. It held a firm yellow
banana with a blue and white Chiquita sticker on it. She
dropped it, horrified, to the carpet, where it became a
sickly yellow grin, miming Flagg's own.
"You'll tell," he whispered. "Oh yes indeed you will."
And Dayna knew he was right.

[ The Stand, by Stephen King ]

References

  1. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 144
  2. ↑ src/dokick.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1115
  3. ↑ src/dig.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 398
  4. ↑ src/dig.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1321
  5. ↑ src/mkobj.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2219: any comestible that can be randomly generated is eligible
  6. ↑ src/mondata.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 232
  7. ↑ src/dog.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 826

A '''banana''' is a type of [[veggy]] [[comestible]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''.

==Generation==
Tourists may start with oranges among their random food items.{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|144|nethack=3.6.7}}

[[Kick]]ing a tree has a one-time {{frac|14|15}} chance of dropping (8−[[rnl]](7)) bananas.{{refsrc|src/dokick.c|1115|nethack=3.6.7}} Cutting down a tree has a {{frac|5}} chance of producing a piece of fruit that can be a banana.{{refsrc|src/dig.c|398|nethack=3.6.7}} If a tree is [[tunnel]]ed through, there is a {{frac|3}} chance of fruit being left behind, which can be a banana.{{refsrc|src/dig.c|1321|nethack=3.6.7}}

[[Apply]]ing a [[charged]] [[horn of plenty]] has a 0.9% chance of generating a banana or two.{{refsrc|src/mkobj.c|2219|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=any comestible that can be randomly generated is eligible}}

==Description==
[[Eating]] a banana confers 80 nutrition. Bananas are vegan, and can be used to tame [[domestic]] [[herbivorous]] [[monster]]s.

[[Ape]]s and [[monkey]]s can be [[tame]]d with thrown bananas, and along with [[sasquatch]]es they regard them as [[treat]]s.{{refsrc|src/mondata.h|232|nethack=3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/dog.c|826|nethack=3.6.7}}

==History==
The banana first appears in Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, which is based on [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], and is included in the initial item list for [[Hack 1.0]].

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], all [[apelike creature]]s can be tamed with thrown bananas.

===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]], the Pacman [[Random vault (UnNetHack)|random vault]] has a guaranteed banana at a random position.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]], [[Pirate]]s start the game with 3-6 bananas; [[incantifier]] Pirates have their bananas replaced with scrolls of {{? of|food detection}}. [[Clockwork Automaton (starting race)|Clockwork automata]] characters in roles that would start with bananas are instead given potions of {{! of|oil}}.

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], Pirates start the game with 3-6 bananas as in dNetHack, and incantifier Pirates receive scrolls of food detection instead.

===Hack'EM===
In [[Hack'EM]], Pirates start the game with 3-6 bananas as in dNetHack.

==Encyclopedia entry==

around the room with his intestines hanging out in steaming

flaming face cocked back, squeezing and contorting with great

"Oh, my dear!" he cried, and went off into another gale of

She looked stupidly down at her hand.  It held a firm yellow
banana with a blue and white Chiquita sticker on it.  She
dropped it, horrified, to the carpet, where it became a
sickly yellow grin, miming Flagg's own.
"You'll tell," he whispered.  "Oh yes indeed you will."
And Dayna knew he was right.
|[ The Stand, by Stephen King ]
